document.docAuthor: Owens, Brittany E. & Carlton, Christopher E.
document.docTitle: Rhexius (Rhexius) jaceus Owens and Carlton 2016, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Collecting in the Museum: New Species, Taxonomic Changes, and Range Extensions of Euplectite Pselaphinae (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae) of the Southeastern United States

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Collecting in the Museum: New Species, Taxonomic Changes, and Range Extensions of Euplectite Pselaphinae (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae) of the Southeastern United States

heading.emphasis:
Rhexius ( Rhexius ) jaceus Owens and Carlton
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type Material.
Holotype , male:
Tennessee : Blount Co. GSMNP,
Rich Mt.
Gap
at 35°38.73N 83°48.33W
595m
Forest litter.
30 July 2004
. R . T . Allen RTA-04-91. ( FMNH )
.
Paratype , one male :
Tennessee : Blount Co. GSMNP,
Rich Mt.
Gap
at 35°38.73N 83°48.33W
595m
Forest litter.
30 July 2004
. R . T
. Allen RTA-04-91. ( LSAM ).
Etymology. The specific epithet refers to the father of the first author, who has provided a lifetime of enthusiastic support and encouragement that has made this study possible.

Diagnosis. This species is distinguished externally from
R. substriatus
,
R. stephani
, and
R. ferrugineus
, by the presence of a wide laterobasal impression on ventrite III (at least two times as wide as the non-impressed area at the apex of ventrite III). Additionally, the aedeagus is unique ( Fig. 14 ), with a flattened, broad ventral lobe and a median lobe bearing three distal extensions and an acute dorsal process ( Fig. 14 ).

Description. Male. Measurements: HL = 0.20 mm , HW = 0.35 mm ; PL = 0.30 mm , PW = 0.35 mm ; EL = 0.48 mm , EW = 0.58 mm ; A1–6, respectively, = 0.10, 0.18, 0.11, 0.10, 0.12, 0.4 mm ; An1–11, respectively, = 0.14, 0.05, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.02, 0.03, 0.02, 0.11 mm ; MP1–4, respectively, = 0.01, 0.02, 0.01, 0.05 mm ; GL = 0.41 mm , GW = 0.25 mm ; ML = 2.2 mm . Integument: Head, pronotum, elytra, and abdomen dark brown, appendages light brown. Entire surface covered with semierect pubescence. Pubescence in gular area longer and denser than on other parts of body, some setae capitate. Abdomen: Ventrite III with basolateral impressions, each impression with vertical shelf at base extending ventrally to apex of ventrite II. Penial plate rounded-ovate. Other ventrites unmodified. Genitalia: Aedeagus asymmetrical. Ventral lobe flattened with patch of distal setae, bearing a semi-circular lamina folded in on right side. Median lobe straight and expanded distally into 3 separate processes with middle process bearing patch of setae apically. Basal bulb rounded, dorsal diaphragm obvious.
Distribution. This species is known only from the type locality: Tennessee : Blount Co.
REDESCRIPTION: Grigarick and Schuster 1980: 21, plate 18, figs. 1–7, plate 75, fig. 3, plate 77, fig. 1.

Rhexius amyae Owens and Carlton
,
new species .
DISTRIBUTION: TN: Blount Co., Sevier Co., Swain Co., Great Smoky Mountains National Park; TN.
DISTRIBUTION: AL, DC, FL, GA, IN, MD, MS, NC, OH, OK, LA, PA, VA.
HABITAT: Litter (cypress marsh edge), grass roots.
DISTRIBUTION: LA: Orleans Parish; FL, GA, IL, LA, MO, MS, OH, OK.
HABITAT: Leaf litter (hardwood), sphagnum moss, rotten wood, flood debris.

Rhexius jaceus Owens and Carlton
,
new species .
DISTRIBUTION: TN: Blount Co., Great Smoky Mountains National Park; TN.

Rhexius schmitti Brendel 1893: 281
, pl. IV, fig. 20.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: AL, AR, FL, GA, IN, KY, MD, MO, MS, NC, OH, OK, PA, VA, WV.
DISTRIBUTION: OK: Latimer Co.; IL, OK, TX.
DISTRIBUTION: FL: Hillsborough Co.; VA: Norfolk; AL, FL, MD, MS, NC, VA.
HABITAT: Leaf litter (sand pine, oak, mixed hardwood).
